com.datastax.dse.driver.api.core.auth

Class BaseDseAuthenticator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.datastax.dse.driver.api.core.auth.BaseDseAuthenticator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Authenticator, SyncAuthenticator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DseGssApiAuthProviderBase.GssApiAuthenticator, PlainTextAuthProviderBase.PlainTextAuthenticator

    @ThreadSafe
public abstract class BaseDseAuthenticator
extends Object
implements SyncAuthenticator
    Base class for SyncAuthenticator implementations that want to make use of the authentication scheme negotiation in DseAuthenticator.

    • Method Detail

      • getMechanism

        @NonNull
protected abstract ByteBuffer getMechanism()
        Return a byte buffer containing the required SASL mechanism.

        This should be one of:

        • PLAIN
        • GSSAPI
        This must be either a read-only buffer, or a new instance every time.

      • getInitialServerChallenge

        @NonNull
protected abstract ByteBuffer getInitialServerChallenge()
        Return a byte buffer containing the expected successful server challenge.

        This should be one of:

        • PLAIN-START
        • GSSAPI-START
        This must be either a read-only buffer, or a new instance every time.

      • initialResponseSync

        @Nullable
public ByteBuffer initialResponseSync()
        Description copied from interface: SyncAuthenticator
        Obtain an initial response token for initializing the SASL handshake.

        SyncAuthenticator.initialResponse() calls this and wraps the result in an immediately completed future.

        Specified by:
        initialResponseSync in interface SyncAuthenticator
        Returns:
        The initial response to send to the server (which may be null). Note that, if the returned byte buffer is writable, the driver will clear its contents immediately after use (to avoid keeping sensitive information in memory); do not reuse the same buffer across multiple invocations. Alternatively, if the contents are not sensitive, you can make the buffer read-only and safely reuse it.

      • onAuthenticationSuccessSync

        public void onAuthenticationSuccessSync(@Nullable
                                        ByteBuffer token)
        Description copied from interface: SyncAuthenticator
        Called when authentication is successful with the last information optionally sent by the server.

        SyncAuthenticator.onAuthenticationSuccess(ByteBuffer) calls this, and then returns an immediately completed future.

        Specified by:
        onAuthenticationSuccessSync in interface SyncAuthenticator
        Parameters:
        token - the information sent by the server with the authentication successful message. This will be null if the server sends no particular information on authentication success.
